subject: Law
title: White-Collar Crime
description: A quick win: understand White-Collar Crime.

hook.text: Bernie Madoff stole $65 billion without a weapon, a mask, or a getaway car. His tool was trust.

buildup.text: White-collar crimes are non-violent offenses committed through deception for financial gain.

discovery.text: Common types include fraud, embezzlement, insider trading, money laundering, and tax evasion.

twist.text: White-collar crimes often cause more total harm than street crime but receive lighter sentences on average.

climax.text: The Enron scandal led to Sarbanes-Oxley, tightening corporate accountability and financial reporting.

punchline.text: The most expensive crimes happen in boardrooms, not alleys.
